title: Reading with the RedHawks Program
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
READING 

WITH 

THE 

REDHAWKS

READING WITH THE REDHAWKS

summary: Kemba Credit Union and Miami University Athletics are partnering to promote reading during the holiday break through the **Reading with the RedHawks** program. Students track reading hours from **December 15th, 2025 - January 16th, 2026** using individual reading logs. Schools must **reply by Wednesday, December 3rd** to confirm participation and return completed logs by **Thursday, January 22nd**. All students who read 5+ hours receive two complimentary tickets to the Saturday, February 21st basketball doubleheader. Top readers at each school can win Kemba Club Account funds, and top ten overall readers win a pizza party with Miami athletes and Kemba Prize Packs. Schools can win $1,000, $500, $250, or $100 for their library, and top readers will be recognized on-court during the February 21st game. Contact (513) 833-0923 or agreen@miamiohias.com for participation.

title: Head Lice Check Before School Break
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
NURSE'S 

CORNER

NURSE'S CORNER

Dear Parents and Guardians,As we head into the upcoming school break, I kindly ask that you take a few minutes to check your child's head for signs of head lice. School breaks, gatherings and sleepovers are a common time for lice to spread, and early detection and treatment helps us maintain a healthy school environment for all students.If you find any signs of lice or nits, please begin treatment before your child returns to school. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions or need guidance. There is also information about head lice on the school website, under "Departments" then click "School Nursing Offices". Thank you for your support and cooperation!Tonja Fangman, BSN, RN, LSNDistrict Nursefangmant@talawanda.org

summary: The district nurse requests that parents check their children for head lice before returning from the upcoming school break. Lice commonly spread during breaks, gatherings, and sleepovers, so early detection and treatment is important. If lice or nits are found, please treat before returning to school. Additional information is available on the school website under **Departments > School Nursing Offices**. Contact: Tonja Fangman, BSN, RN, LSN at fangmant@talawanda.org.

summary: The December 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. **Breakfast options** include items like Apple Cinnamon Texas French Toast, French Toast Sticks, Mini Powdered Donuts, Mini Cinnamon Pull Apart, Sausage Egg & Cheese Biscuit Sandwich, Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Pizza, Egg & Cheese English Muffin Sandwich, Maple Snack'n Waffle, Chocolate Donut Holes, Mini Maple Pancakes, Breakfast Burrito, Apple or Cherry Frudel, French Toast Bites, and Biscuits & Sausage Gravy. **Lunch options** include French Toast Sticks, Walking Taco w/Doritos, Boneless Chicken Wings, Rotini & Italian Meat Sauce, Bosco Sticks, Pizza Cruncher Bites, Mini Confetti Pancakes, Chicken Nuggets, Mini Cheese Pizza Bagels, Cheeseburger on a Bun, Apple Cinnamon Texas French Toast, Nachos w/Taco Meat & Cheese, Holiday Meal (Roast Turkey and Gravy, Mashed Potatoes), Popcorn Chicken, and Chicken Patty on Bun. **100% Fruit Juice, Assorted Fruit, and Yogurt** are included with every breakfast. **Choice of Milk is included with every lunch.** Menus are subject to change based on product availability.

summary: The **Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee** is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses) and glasses cases to donate to children worldwide. The lenses and frames are modified to meet individual children's eye needs, with 900+ pairs sent annually. **Donations can be sent to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary School or Shaunna Tafelski at the Board Office by the beginning of December.** The Lions Club is happy to pick up donations if needed.

title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation Event
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
AROUND 

THE 

COMMUNITY 

AROUND THE COMMUNITY

summary: **Project Reboot** presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on **Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School**. The event features a 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A covering tech addiction, how to discuss screen time with kids, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. The presentation is hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot, and all attendees will receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. PSD approved event. More info at https://projectreboot.school

summary: The **Marshall Free Pantry** is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and is open to all students. Available items include veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, apple sauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, toothpaste, and other hygiene products. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker, at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

title: Marshall PTG Updates and Events
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
PTG 

CORNER

PTG CORNER

summary: The **Marshall Parent Teacher Group (PTG)** supports Marshall Elementary through fundraising and community events. Current fundraisers include **Fall Mum Flower Sale, Glow Dance Party Boosterthon, Spring Flower Sale, and Box Tops for Education**. The PTG hosts **25-26 new family, student, and staff events** throughout the 2025-2026 school year, including skate parties, staff meals, the Spring Fling Dance (April 24, 2026), Mayfest (May 15, 2026), and various conferences and appreciation events. They also support field trips, R.A.H. (Random Acts of Hospitality), general funding requests, and music receptions year-round.

title: Marshall Mondays and Halloween Parade Information
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
NEWS 

& 

INFORMATION 

NEWS & INFORMATION

We had another wonderful week of learning and fun at Marshall! As the weather starts to get colder, we want to remind families to help students come to school prepared for outdoor recess. We go outside whenever possible, so please be sure your child has a warm coat, hat, or other layers to stay comfortable throughout the day. Mornings can be quite chilly, even if it warms up later, so sending a jacket or sweatshirt is always a good idea. Thank you for helping us keep students healthy, active, and ready to enjoy their time outside!Looking ahead, we‚Äôre excited to celebrate Halloween together next week! Our annual Halloween Parade will take place on Friday, October 31st, at 9:30 a.m. Grown-ups can drop students off as usual, then park in the upper lot and join us for some community fun before the parade begins. Enjoy free doughnuts and great conversation with other Marshall families, and grab a coffee or hot chocolate for purchase in the shelter. Everyone can head to the back lot around 9:25 to get ready for the parade kickoff. We can‚Äôt wait to see all the creative costumes and smiling faces!Sincerely,Mrs. Jones, Principal

summary: **Marshall Mondays** begin **10/20** - students should wear Talawanda gear, Marshall Elementary shirts, or red, white, and blue every Monday through the end of the year to show school spirit. As weather gets colder, please send students with warm coats and layers for outdoor recess. The **Halloween Parade** is scheduled for **Friday, October 31st at 9:30 a.m.** - families can park in the upper lot, enjoy free doughnuts and coffee/hot chocolate for purchase, and gather in the back lot around 9:25 for the parade.

title: Project Reboot: Tech Healthy Household Presentation
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Project 

Reboot

Project Reboot

summary: **Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household"** on **Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School**. This PSD-approved 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), how to discuss screen time with kids without eye rolling, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, founder of Project Reboot and digital wellness presenter who has spoken to over 20,000 students and parents. All attendees receive actionable resources and dinner table discussion guides. Grant support provided by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

Needed items include instant mashed potatoes (any flavor), stuffing mix, gravy pouches, soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken), and canned vegetables (beans, corn, mixed vegetables). The class that donates the most items will win a pizza party.

summary: The **October 2025 breakfast and lunch menus** for Marshall Elementary are now available. A **Fall Break** is scheduled for October 17, 2025, with no school that day. Special days include **National Apple Day on October 21** and **Halloween on October 31**. Menu is subject to change based on product availability.
